Description: Ostracon (?), large section of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel with cylindrical body and tapering neck, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a glossy dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of one line of red-painted Coptic (?) text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394880) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394880)
